description_txt: stated on July 11, 2009 in his weekly radio address:
quote_txt: The stimulus "has delivered $43 billion in tax relief to American working families and businesses"

description_txt: stated on July 15, 2009 in a television interview:
quote_txt: On mandating health care coverage.

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2009 in a Washington Post op-ed:
quote_txt: On a cap-and-trade plan.

description_txt: stated on July 15, 2009 in a news release.:
quote_txt: The Obama administration has spent millions of taxpayer dollars for roadside signs to tout the economic stimulus.

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2009 in an op-ed article in the Washington Post.:
quote_txt: "Job losses are so certain under this new cap-and-tax plan that it includes a provision accommodating newly unemployed workers from the resulting dried-up energy sector, to the tune of $4.2 billion over eight years. So much for creating jobs."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2009 in public statements:
quote_txt: On a single-payer health care system.

description_txt: stated on July 12, 2009 in an interview on This Week with George Stephanopolous.:
quote_txt: "Only about 6.8 percent of the (stimulus) money has actually been spent."

description_txt: stated on July 9, 2009 in a news release.:
quote_txt: "Across the country, $174 billion of the Recovery Act have been committed in its first 130 days."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2009 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: Rep. Adam Putnam was silent when Rush Limbaugh called Sonia Sotomayor a racist.

description_txt: stated on July 7, 2009 in a GOP survey:
quote_txt: The Obama administration offered "$900 million to Hamas, a recognized terrorist organization, to rebuild Gaza."

description_txt: stated on July 7, 2009 in a GOP survey:
quote_txt: "Under the new and little known 'global justice' initiative," the Obama administration has ordered FBI agents to "read Miranda Rights to high-value terrorist detainees captured on the battlefield."

description_txt: stated on July 13, 2009 in a Senate hearing:
quote_txt: "Now, there was a time when someone like Scalia and Ginsburg got 95-plus votes."

description_txt: stated on July 12, 2009 in a television interview:
quote_txt: A new Rasmussen poll shows people "oppose (Sotomayor's) confirmation. Only 37 percent support it."

description_txt: stated on July 1, 2009 in a column in Human Events.:
quote_txt: "Obama's Justice-designate Sotomayor threw out (the New Haven firefighters') lawsuit in a sneaky, unsigned opinion -- the judicial equivalent of 'talk to the hand.'"

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2009 in his radio show:
quote_txt: On the day the House voted on the climate change bill, "there was not even a copy of the bill in the well of the House, which is standard. It wasn't even written."

description_txt: stated on July 8, 2009 in a PBS interview.:
quote_txt: "We were promised. The president said we would keep unemployment under 8.5 percent (if the stimulus passed)."

description_txt: stated on July 6, 2009 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: "We import more oil today than ever before."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2009 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: "In North Carolina, they used stimulus money to hire one new state worker. His job, apply for more stimulus funds from the taxpayers by the way of the federal government."

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2009 in a Web ad:
quote_txt: "In Wisconsin, the stimulus paid for a bridge to a bar called Rusty's Backwater Saloon. They've got great burgers, but no new jobs."

description_txt: stated on June 29, 2009 in a speech at the White House.:
quote_txt: "Californians consume 40 percent less energy per person than the national average"

description_txt: stated on July 2, 2009 in a television ad:
quote_txt: Mitch McConnell opposed "legislation to create and protect Kentucky jobs . . . help for the unemployed. . .  health care for Kentucky's children," and "fair pay for women."

description_txt: stated on June 25, 2009 in an e-mail received by many people.:
quote_txt: "The ACLU has filed a suit to have all military cross-shaped headstones removed."

description_txt: stated on June 28, 2009 in interview on This Week with George Stephanopoulos:
quote_txt: "If the United States moves ahead by itself (on cap-and-trade)... after 30 or 40 years, we're going to reduce CO2 by less than 1 percent."

description_txt: stated on May 24, 2009 in an e-mail received by many people.:
quote_txt: The Free Flow of Information Act of 2009 "would guarantee Barack Obama will never be held accountable for producing forged birth documents."

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2009 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: During a town hall meeting on health care, "ABC didn't even allow ads that opposed the president's health care plan to be aired."

description_txt: stated on June 18, 2009 in a Washington Post op-ed:
quote_txt: Every year tobacco kills more Americans than did World War II — more than AIDS, cocaine, heroin, alcohol, vehicular accidents, homicide and suicide combined.

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2009 in an interview with the Washington Times.:
quote_txt: ACORN will be a paid partner with the Census Bureau and "they will be in charge of going door-to-door and collecting data from the American public."

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2009 in a Washington Times interview:
quote_txt: Says the Constitution only requires her to tell the census "how many people are in our home."

description_txt: stated on June 24, 2009 in a town hall meeting:
quote_txt: "Medicare and Medicaid are the single biggest drivers of the federal deficit and the federal debt by a huge margin."

description_txt: stated on June 20, 2009 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Says the Congressional Budget Office estimates a cap-and-trade program would cost the average family the equivalent of "a postage stamp a day."
